TITLE: Time for the Fed to declare victory on inflation? Not yet
SUMMARY: The question now is how much more evidence policymakers will need to see before they take their foot off the brake.

TITLE: Consumer prices fell 0.1% in December, in line with expectations from economists
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to decrease 0.1% on a monthly basis and increase 6.5% from a year ago in December, according to Dow Jones.

TITLE: World Bank makes big cut to its 2023 growth outlook, says globe is 'perilously close' to recession
SUMMARY: The World Bank slashed its global growth forecasts from projections it made in mid-2022 on the back of what it sees as broadly worsening economic conditions.

TITLE: France's government outlines plans to raise retirement age despite years of pushback
SUMMARY: France's legal retirement age is currently 62 — lower than many developed markets, including much of Europe and the U.S.

TITLE: Consumers see inflation—and spending—cooling off in the year ahead, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: The one-year inflation outlook declined to 5%, down 0.2 percentage point from the previous month and the lowest level since July 2021.

TITLE: U.S. unemployment rate falls in December, but rises for Black women, Hispanic men
SUMMARY: Those figures bucked the trend in the broader economy, which showed unemployment in the U.S. fall to 3.5%.

TITLE: Nonfarm payrolls rose 223,000 in December, as strong jobs market tops expectations
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls increased by 223,000 for the month, above the Dow Jones estimate for 200,000, while the unemployment rate fell to 3.5%.

TITLE: Private payroll growth surged by 235,000 in December, well above estimate, ADP reports
SUMMARY: Private payrolls rose by 235,000 for the month, well ahead of the 153,000 Dow Jones estimate.

TITLE: Job openings hold strong despite rate hikes; manufacturing in contraction
SUMMARY: Demand for employment remained high in November as companies looked for workers to fill positions despite worries of a looming recession.

TITLE: The UK recession will be almost as deep as that of Russia, economists predict
SUMMARY: The U.K.'s economic contraction in 2023 will be almost as deep as that of Russia, economists expect, as a sharp fall in household living standards weighs on activity.

TITLE: Global economy is heading into a decade of low growth, economist says
SUMMARY: The global economy likely faces a decade of sluggish growth, according to Daniel Lacalle, author and chief economist at Tressis Gestion.

TITLE: Retail sales fell 0.6% in November as consumers feel the pressure from inflation
SUMMARY: Consumers pulled back on spending in November, failing to keep up with even a muted level of inflation.

TITLE: ECB hikes rates, sees significant increases ahead as it announces plan to shrink balance sheet
SUMMARY: The European Central Bank opted for a smaller rate hike at its Thursday meeting, taking its key rate from 1.5% to 2%.

TITLE: Here's everything the Federal Reserve is expected to do Wednesday
SUMMARY: Here's a quick look at the multiple variables that will come into play when this week's Fed meeting concludes Wednesday.

TITLE: UK inflation falls from 41-year high as fuel price surge eases
SUMMARY: U.K. inflation came in slightly below expectations at 10.7% in November, as cooling fuel prices helped ease price pressures.

TITLE: Consumer prices rose less than expected in November, up 7.1% from a year ago
SUMMARY: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.3% in November, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Consumers see inflation easing considerably in the next year, New York Fed survey shows
SUMMARY: A survey indicated that consumers see one-year inflation running at a 5.2% pace, down 0.7 percentage point from the October reading.

TITLE: Wholesale prices rose 0.3% in November, more than expected, despite hopes that inflation is cooling
SUMMARY: The producer price index, a measure of what companies get for their products in the pipeline, increased 0.3% for the month and 7.4% from a year ago.

TITLE: Saudi Arabia reports its first budget surplus in nearly 10 years on higher oil prices
SUMMARY: The 2022 surplus came to 102 billion riyals ($27 billion), constituting 2.6% of Saudi gross domestic product, the kingdom's finance ministry said.

TITLE: The Fed's path to a 'Goldilocks' economy just got a little more complicated
SUMMARY: As far as jobs reports go, November's wasn't exactly what the Federal Reserve was looking for.

TITLE: November unemployment fell for Hispanic workers and Black women, while holding steady overall
SUMMARY: The U.S. unemployment rate remained unchanged at 3.7% in November.

TITLE: Here's where the jobs are for November 2022 — in one chart
SUMMARY: Service sector categories showed strong growth in November, while other areas lost jobs.

TITLE: Payrolls and wages blow past expectations, flying in the face of Fed rate hikes
SUMMARY: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 200,000 in November, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Key inflation measure that the Fed follows rose 0.2% in October, less than expected
SUMMARY: The core personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to rise 0.3% in October and 5% from a year ago, according to Dow Jones estimates.

TITLE: Fed hikes and a stronger dollar are fueling risks of political instability in Africa
SUMMARY: The Fed's policy tightening and a strengthening dollar are having a knock-on effect on African nations' balance sheets and public debt burdens.

TITLE: Watch Fed Chair Jerome Powell speak on the economy and monetary policy
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is slated to speak Wednesday at the Brookings Institution.

TITLE: Job openings fell in October amid Fed efforts to cool labor market
SUMMARY: The Job Openings and Labor Turnover Survey, a closely watched gauge of slack in the labor force, showed there were 10.3 million vacancies for the month.

TITLE: Private hiring increased by just 127,000 jobs in November, well below estimate, ADP reports
SUMMARY: Companies added just 127,000 positions for the month, a steep reduction from the 239,000 the firm reported for October

TITLE: Elon Musk says the Fed must cut rates ‘immediately’ to stop a severe recession
SUMMARY: In a tweet early Wednesday, Musk called on the Fed "to cut interest rates immediately" or risk "amplifying the probability of a severe recession."

TITLE: Transitory inflation talk is back. But economists say higher prices are here to stay
SUMMARY: Global markets have taken heart in recent weeks from data indicating that inflation may have peaked, but analysts have warned against the return of the "transitory" inflation narrative.
